answers.answer: Thanks for using the forum.The "normal" range values for blood glucose have been lowered over the past several years. What was once "normal" is not considered borderline high/high. Your value is within the current "normal" range. This does not make you pre diabetic. However, it is good that you are aware of the value and can work at making good food and lifestyle choices to help reduce your chances of developing a problem in the future.It is possible for stress to slightly raise the blood glucose level. My recommendation would be to keep track of the level each time it is drawn. If you start to see it rise, talk with your doctor about what would be suggested at that point.Hope this helpsCathy
